purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application resource for the representation of risk.
The aspects of risk management, whether positive or negative, that result in an opportunity for benefit or threat to it succeeding are included.
The risk_schema identifies risks as they are perceived each with their probability and consequences pertaining to events or situations.

inscope.li: representation of the relationships between risks;

assignment of any items impacted by the risk;
identification and representation of a risk criteria;

assignment of classification information to risk data.

definition.def: the potential for realization of unwanted negative consequences of an event.

introduction.p: The risk_schema identifies a risk by specifying the potential for realization of unwanted negative consequences of an event. A risk is accounted by the existence of general uncertainty and feared events.
introduction.note: A risk associated with general uncertainty is refered to as unknown unknowns
A risk of feared events is refered to as known unknowns
introduction.p: The identification of a risk can describe the concern at hand which may be related to more than one event with more than one possible outcome or consequence.
introduction.example: Project Bravo has entered Phase II with a major subsystem functioning in Mode Number 5.
introduction.p: As risk is always present, more than one perception of a risk is possible. The representaion of a risk_perception describes a risk in a particular context along with the probability of an event and its corresponding consequence or consequences.

A risk is not limited to events but may apply to products, people, organizations, or to other items of interest, as defined by Application Protocols or Modules that use this resource part that have the potential for generating risks of general uncertainty.

fund_cons.p: A can be determinately identifed by a set of recognisable assessments or perceptions that can be used to distinguish all relevant possible outcomes.
In this part of ISO 10303 such a perception is recorded as an instance of the entity.
fund_cons.note: A is susceptible to reassessment over time.
fund_cons.p: Providing meaningful value for an assessment requires that a comparison be made against predetermined standards or criteria to which a value-based judgement or decision point can be made. The evaluation of such an assessment is represented by .
